cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles south of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast along the Mid-Atlantic coast, forecast to pass offshore of the Delmarva Peninsula Friday, then accelerate toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: North Carolina coast near Cape Fear

weather_observation.watch_coast: No hurricane or tropical-storm watches in effect north of Fenwick Island DE or north of Drum Point on the Chesapeake Bay.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from the NC/VA border to Fenwick Island DE, including Chesapeake Bay south of Drum Point and the lower tidal Potomac.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coast from Cape Fear NC northward across the Outer Banks, southeastern Virginia, Delmarva beaches, and later southeastern New England.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤7%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 kt possible Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal anomalies (<2 ft) possible in upper Chesapeake Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain in bands Friday into early Saturday could cause brief ponding and reduced visibility.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and dangerous rip currents along Maryland Atlantic beaches; possible temporary vessel traffic restrictions in Chesapeake approaches.
